item.title: When is The Next Fortnite Update? Fortnite v39.40, Explained
item.content:encoded:
New content continues to come thick and fast in Fortnite, which always leads to discussions about when the next major update is on the horizon, and v39.40 is right around the corner.

2026 has already gotten off to a flying start for the Battle Royale behemoth, with major collabs with the likes of South Park and The Office, and Epic Games is showing no signs of slowing down.

Fortnite v39.40 is due to arrive this week, and Insider Gaming has all the important details on when it drops and an overview of the content set to be added.

When is The Next Fortnite Update?

Fortnite’s next update is set to arrive on Thursday, February 5, with Epic Games deploying v39.40 into the fold.

Epic Games has settled into a fairly regular update schedule for Fortnite, with major updates and downtime coming every two to three weeks. With the last update occurring on January 22, it’s time for a new update.

This won’t be the final update of Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1, however, as it’s likely there is at least one more update midway through the month before the new season kicks off in early March.

What’s Coming in Fortnite v39.40?

Fortnite v39.40 is packed full of major collabs, including a brand new Fortnite Festival season.

Fortnite Festival Season 13 is expected to feature Chappel Roan as the headline act, with teasers for her addition already appearing in the game and being uncovered in datamines.

It’s not just Fortnite Festival set to star, however, as Epic Games has already teased a big crossover with Honkai Star Rail, which is expected to arrive in the update, along with the second wave of KPop Demon Hunter cosmetics, including a Jinu skin and Derp as a Sidekick.

The update will also see the end of the South Park collab and the departure of the Born in Chaos Mini Pass, so there are only a few more days left to claim all the rewards.

Additionally, there will also be some bug fixes and adjustments, as is customary with Fortnite patches, but the general gameplay won’t be overhauled significantly.

What are you hoping to see added to Fortnite in the next update? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out teasers for an update coming that will ‘spice up’ the current season, and read about rumors of an upcoming Overwatch collab.

item.title: Romeo Is A Dead Man Release Date Countdown & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
When it comes to breaking boundaries in video games, there are few who do it better than Goichi “Suda51” Suda. Romeo Is A Dead Man is his studio’s first new concept in over five years, and it’s finally almost here.

If you can’t wait to see what Suda51 has cooked up next, then don’t worry, as Insider Gaming has all the release date information for Romeo Is A Dead Man down below.

When Is Romeo Is A Dead Man Coming Out?

Romeo Is A Dead Man is primed for a February 11 release date, though that can depend on where in the world you are.

Suda51 is the mastermind behind Romeo Is A Dead Man, and if you’ve played any of his titles before, you’ll be dying to see what he has up his sleeve. Luckily for you, that date isn’t too far off, as you’ll only need to wait until the second week of February.

That being said, February is set to be a busy month in the world of gaming. Both Nioh 3 and Resident Evil Requiem are bound to steal headlines, but Romeo Is A Dead Man has the potential to be the month’s underdog.

Romeo Is A Dead Man Release Times

Romeo Is A Dead Man is expected to release at 4 PM PST on February 10, with adjusted times for other regions.

If you’re looking for a quick date and time reference so you know when you can begin playing Romeo Is A Dead Man, then check out the table below:

If you’re in the US, you’re in luck, as you can get your hands on Romeo Is A Dead Man earlier than most!

If you’re excited for Romeo Is A Dead Man, come and share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the 7 biggest upcoming soulslike games in 2026.

item.title: Pokémon Go February 2026 Roadmap Schedule: Go Tour Kalos, Raid Dates & More
item.content:encoded:
A new month in Pokémon Go means another calendar packed full of events, highlighted by debut Pokémon, new Shiny Pokémon to obtain, and a host of boosts to take advantage of.

Whether you’re looking to fill your calendar with all the Pokémon Go events in February 2026, or want to make sure you don’t miss out on your favorite Pokémon during a Spotlight Hour, Insider Gaming has all the details you need.

Pokémon Go February 2026 Event Schedule

Pokémon Go’s biggest highlights in February include the Go Tour, available globally at the back-end of the month, and the Valentine’s Day event.

Flamingo also makes its Pokémon Go debut this month, while the Shiny debuts on the cards are Diancie, Honedge, Klefki, and Hawlucha.

Check out the full schedule below.

Pokémon Go February 2026 Raid Schedule

The raid schedule in Pokémon Go for February 2026 includes a host of challenging encounters, including Shadow Regigigas.

Check out the full raid schedule below.

Pokémon Go February 2026 Spotlight Hour Schedule

Spotlight Hours for February 2026 include one of the starters in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, Totodile, along with Horsea, Whismur, and Munna.

Pokémon Spotlight hours take place on Tuesday between 6 PM and 7 PM local time. The full schedule for February 2026 is below.

Pokémon Go February 2026 Max Battles Schedule

Max Battles for February 2026 feature Wailmer, Growlithe, Machop, and Chansey, all of whom also feature on Max Mondays.

Max Mondays take place every week from 6 PM to 7 PM local time. The full schedule for the month is shown below.

What are your main targets to achieve in Pokémon Go this month? Share your goals in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, check out the dates for Pokémon Day 2026, and take a look at all the LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt codes to redeem.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Exact Release Date & Start Times
item.content:encoded:
New content continues to come thick and fast in Marvel Rivals, with the release date for Season 6.5 now rapidly approaching.

The launch of Season 6 made waves with the long-awaited addition of Deadpool, but NetEase is not resting on their laurels and have plenty more up their sleeves in future drops.

For all the details on the Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 release date, start times, and what to expect, Insider Gaming has you covered.

When Does Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Release?

Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 kicks off on February 13, but the mid-season transition means you won’t need to rapidly grind through the Battle Pass.

As is customary in the mid-seasdon update, the Season 6 Battle Pass will continue, but there will be new additions in Season 6.5, including new cosmetics and likely limited-time passes.

The slew of new content won’t be as big as was seen at the start of Season 6, however, with the next big drop instead coming at the start of Season 7 in May.

Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Start Times

The start time for Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 has not been confirmed, but previous updates suggest the season will kick off at 2 AM PT on February 13.

That means a later start in morning for those elsewhere in the United States, though it will still be in the early hours, while those in Europe have to wait until mid-morning, and those down under must wait until th evening.

The table below shows the expected Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 start times in major regions across the world.

All Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Content

After Deadpool’s arrival at the start of Season 6, Season 6.5 is headlined by the arrival of Elsa Bloodstone as the latest playable character.

New maps and new cosmetics are also set to be introduced, and there will likely be a Valentine’s Day collab introduced at the start of the season.

Marvel Rivals could also issue further hints towards additions coming in the Season 7 launch in March, adding to the speculation after a gallery card featured teases for Black Cat and White Fox.

What do you want to see added to Marvel Rivals in Season 6.5? Share your ideas in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals, read how Deadpool’s addition led to a huge boom in player numbers, and check out the verdict on whether the Season 6 Battle Pass is worth buying.

item.title: Nioh 3 Release Date Countdown & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
Soulslike fans are in for another rough and rewarding ride with Nioh 3. Team Ninja brings back its acclaimed Souls series, and this guide quickly tells you the Nioh 3 release date and what time it’s dropping.

It’s easy to see why Nioh 3 is one of the biggest upcoming Soulslike games in 2026. The team behind it is an expert in making eye-catching worlds, overcome by beauty and big Yokai beasts that will cut you down in your prime. Team Ninja‘s Nioh 3 could go down as the best Soulslike this year.

When Is Nioh 3 Coming Out?

Nioh 3 is all set for a February 6 release date across multiple platforms around the world.

While there have been questions about possible Nioh 3 early access and a demo, there’s no doubt about the game’s release date. Nioh 3 drops at the end of the first week in February, getting the month off to a feisty start!

  • More IG: Nioh 3 has a timed console exclusivity deal with Playstation

February is normally when the gaming year heats up. After a quiet December and January, publishers start launching new games, and Nioh 3 is one of the biggest AAA releases in 2026 to this point.

Nioh 3 Release Times

Nioh 3 is expected to have a midnight launch across all regions, meaning you can start playing from 6 PM PT on February 5, with adjusted times for other regions.

If you want a quick date and time reference so you know when you can start playing Nioh 3, the table below has many of the main areas covered.

Check out when you can start playing Nioh 3.

As usual, Australasia gets the short end of the stick, but Nioh 3 is sure to be worth the wait. You’ll have an answer to this soon with the end of the Nioh 3 review embargo!

If you played the demo or any Nioh game in general, share your thoughts about the franchise via the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Also, if you didn’t know, any Nioh 3 demo progress you make will carry over to the full game.
